title: Mercury conjunct Venus
summary: A convergence of thinking and values. Communication becomes more attuned to tone, preference, and relational context. The opportunity is to express ideas in ways that reflect what you actually value.

meaning.headline: Thought and expression align with what you value.

frames.text: Mercury–Venus conjunctions align thinking with values, making communication more considered and relationally aware.
This aspect supports expressing ideas in ways that reflect taste, preference, and social context.
Words may land more smoothly when intention and tone are aligned.
Decision-making benefits from weighing what feels right alongside what makes sense.
This guarantees agreement, likability, or persuasion.

frictions: Indecision caused by weighing too many preferences

do: Choose words that reflect what you actually value.
Listen for what matters to others, not just what’s said.
Let tone support meaning, not replace it.
avoid: Saying what sounds good instead of what’s true
Avoiding clarity to keep things pleasant

reusable_lines.text: Communication works best when words reflect values.
Tone matters most when it supports clarity.

allowed_framing: Agency-forward framing: 'you can choose how to say it…'
Contextual framing: 'if conversations or decisions are in focus…'

sources: Mercury–Venus conjunction as cognition/value alignment archetype
